title: Agropyron trachycaulum ssp. subsecundus - slender wheatgrass
description: Slender wheatgrass growing in open dry montane meadows or parkland surrounded by forests comprising mostly Douglas Fir (Pseudotsuga menziesii). Slender wheatgrass is more common along roadsides and is an uncommon bunchgrass in this area of open native vegetation. This site lies along the main gravel road just west of Burley Peak between Sapphire Village and Checkerboard, central eastern Little Belt Mountains, Judith Basin County, Montana. Subsecundum is a form that has a secund spike and lemma awns often 17-40 mm long.
label: Original
